result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas Bryan Scace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas Bryan Scace

records.addlTxt:
Installment Payment Agreement for Fine or Forfeiture.
Pay $25 per month beginning 12-07-2016  Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $30 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served.

Douglas Bryan Scace, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant pleads no contest. Found guilty sentenced to 2 days jail, 2 days credit, payment of costs.

Douglas Bryan Scace, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Violation - Bail Jumping-Misd.  Issuing Agency - GCSD.
  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.    May not enter establishments that sell intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.

  May not possess or consume any intoxicants.    May not enter establishments that sell intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.

Douglas Bryan Scace, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.  
  Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
